text: St Peter's College is one of the colleges of the University of Oxford. The college was founded in 1929. It became a full college of the University in 1961. The college is located on the site of the former New Hall Inn. Its oldest buildings are Linden House (1794) and Canal House (1828). Both were former headquarters of the Oxford Canal Company. ==References== Category:Colleges of the University of Oxford Category:1929 establishments in the United Kingdom Category:1920s establishments in England
title: St Peter's College, Oxford
